duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide basic patient care under the direction of the Charge Nurse/LN Supervisor.
Assist residents with activities of daily life (ADLs) such as eating, dressing, grooming, toileting, and mobility.
Encourage resident's independence in completing ADLs if able to.
Document ADLs accurately and take preventative measures to help residents avoid falls and skin breakdown.
Assist at mealtime, distribute meal trays, pour beverages, and feed residents in need of assistance.
Observe and report changes in resident's behavior and physical symptoms to nurses.
Uphold safety and infection control standards by practicing universal safety and sanitary precautions, handling clean and dirty linens, and maintaining a neat, clean, and safety-oriented work area.
Establish effective team relationships, communicate effectively, and demonstrate professionalism and compassion with residents and colleagues.
Adhere to all company policies, procedures, safety, and compliance practices, and business ethics codes.
